artist: Kikugawa Eizan; Published by Wakasaya Yoichi
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Two o_ban sheets were joined vertically to create a large image of a beauty. Such formats are called kakemono-e (hanging scroll pictures) as they were often mounted with a paper border and backing onto a simple hanging scroll and used as relatively inexpensive house decoration by townspeople. For this reason, these prints rarely survived in their original state and condition.
title: (Woman Holding a Roll of Paper)
